name: Pre-Matric Scholarship for SC/ST Students
description: Central government scholarship for SC/ST students studying in classes 9 and 10 to support their education and reduce dropout rates.
benefits: Up to Rs. 3,500 per annum for day scholars and Rs. 7,000 per annum for hostellers. Includes maintenance allowance, book grant, and ad-hoc grant.
applicationSteps: Register with a valid mobile number and email
Fill in personal, academic, and income details

name: Pre-Matric Scholarship for OBC Students
description: Scholarship for OBC students in classes 1 to 10 whose parents' income is within the specified limit, aimed at reducing dropout rates.
benefits: Rs. 1,000 to Rs. 5,500 per annum depending on day scholar or hosteller status and class level.
applicationSteps: Fill in the scholarship application form
Upload OBC certificate and income proof

name: Post-Matric Scholarship for SC Students
description: Central scheme providing financial assistance to SC students studying at post-matriculation or post-secondary level to enable them to complete their education.
benefits: Full tuition fee reimbursement, maintenance allowance of Rs. 550-1,200/month, study tour charges, thesis typing charges, and book allowance.

name: Post-Matric Scholarship for ST Students
description: Financial assistance for ST students studying beyond class 10 in recognized institutions to reduce dropout rates and promote higher education.
benefits: Full tuition and non-refundable fees, maintenance allowance Rs. 550-1,200/month, additional allowances for book bank, thesis, etc.
applicationSteps: Get verified by the educational institution

name: Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for Minorities
description: Scholarship for meritorious students from minority communities (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi) pursuing professional and technical courses.
benefits: Course fee up to Rs. 20,000 per annum and maintenance allowance of Rs. 1,000/month for hostellers, Rs. 500/month for day scholars.

name: Post-Matric Scholarship for Minorities
description: Financial support for minority community students who have passed class 10 and are pursuing further education in recognized institutions.
benefits: Admission and tuition fee, maintenance allowance for hostellers and day scholars. 30% reserved for girl students.

name: AICTE Pragati Scholarship for Girls
description: AICTE scheme to support girl students pursuing technical education (degree/diploma) in AICTE-approved institutions across India.
benefits: Rs. 50,000 per annum (up to Rs. 30,000 tuition fee waiver + Rs. 2,000/month for 10 months for incidentals).
applicationSteps: Visit AICTE portal or National Scholarship Portal
Register with valid email and mobile
Fill in academic and family income details

name: AICTE Saksham Scholarship for Disabled Students
description: AICTE scheme providing financial support to differently-abled students pursuing technical education in AICTE-approved institutions.
benefits: Rs. 50,000 per annum (up to Rs. 30,000 tuition fee + Rs. 2,000/month for incidentals). For up to 4 years of degree or 3 years of diploma.

name: Maharashtra EWS Scholarship
description: Scholarship for economically weaker section students from Maharashtra pursuing higher education in the state.
benefits: Full tuition fee reimbursement and exam fees for students in government and aided institutions.
applicationSteps: Fill in details and upload documents

name: Karnataka Post-Matric Scholarship for SC/ST
description: State scholarship for SC/ST students from Karnataka pursuing post-matric education in recognized institutions within or outside the state.
benefits: Full fee reimbursement including tuition, exam, and maintenance fees. Hostel charges covered for hostellers.

name: Tamil Nadu BC/MBC Scholarship
description: Scholarship for Backward Class and Most Backward Class students from Tamil Nadu pursuing higher education.
benefits: Tuition fee waiver and monthly maintenance allowance for students in government colleges.
applicationSteps: Apply through Tamil Nadu e-Scholarship portal
Fill in community and income details

name: Uttar Pradesh Post-Matric Scholarship for OBC
description: Scholarship for OBC students of Uttar Pradesh pursuing education beyond class 10 in recognized institutions.
benefits: Fee reimbursement and maintenance allowance based on course type and hosteller/day scholar status.
applicationSteps: Register as a new student or log in for renewal
Fill in the application form completely
Submit and take printout for institution

name: Rajasthan Gargi Award for Girls
description: Award for meritorious girl students from Rajasthan who scored 75% or above in their board exams and are continuing higher education.
benefits: Rs. 3,000 for class 10 pass and Rs. 5,000 for class 12 pass students who scored 75%+ marks.
applicationSteps: Register with board exam roll number

name: Begum Hazrat Mahal National Scholarship
description: Scholarship for meritorious girls from minority communities studying in classes 9 to 12, funded by Maulana Azad Education Foundation.
benefits: Rs. 5,000 for class 9-10 students and Rs. 6,000 for class 11-12 students per annum.
applicationSteps: Visit the MAEF website or NSP
Register and fill the application form

name: INSPIRE Scholarship (SHE) for Science Students
description: Department of Science and Technology scholarship for students pursuing BSc/BS/integrated MS courses in natural and basic sciences.
benefits: Rs. 80,000 per annum (Rs. 60,000 scholarship + Rs. 20,000 summer research project mentorship).
applicationSteps: Check eligibility criteria (top 1% in board or JEE/NEET rank holders)
Upload academic records and bank details

name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship (NMMSS)
description: Central government scheme for meritorious students from economically weaker sections studying in class 9 to 12 in government schools.
benefits: Rs. 12,000 per annum (Rs. 1,000 per month) for classes 9 to 12.
applicationSteps: Appear for the state-level NMMSS exam in class 8
Selected students apply through NSP from class 9
Fill in personal and academic details

name: Prime Minister's Scholarship for RPF/RPSF Wards
description: Scholarship for children of RPF/RPSF/CISF personnel for pursuing higher professional education.
benefits: Rs. 2,500/month for boys and Rs. 3,000/month for girls for the duration of the course (4-5 years).
applicationSteps: Register as ward of RPF/RPSF personnel

name: Ishan Uday Scholarship for North-Eastern Students
description: UGC scholarship for students from North-Eastern states pursuing higher education in colleges/universities across India.
benefits: Rs. 5,400/month for professional courses and Rs. 3,500/month for other courses for 5 years max.
applicationSteps: Register with domicile details from NE state

name: Madhya Pradesh Gaon Ki Beti Scheme
description: Scholarship for rural girls from Madhya Pradesh who scored 60%+ in class 12 board exams, to encourage higher education.
benefits: Rs. 5,000 per annum (Rs. 500/month for 10 months) for each year of undergraduate study.
applicationSteps: Fill in academic details and class 12 marks

name: West Bengal Kanyashree Prakalpa
description: Conditional cash transfer scheme for girls in West Bengal to promote education and prevent child marriage.
benefits: Annual scholarship of Rs. 750 (K1) for girls aged 13-18 in school, and one-time grant of Rs. 25,000 (K2) at age 18 if unmarried and in education.
applicationSteps: Fill in personal and family details

name: Top Class Education Scheme for SC Students
description: Scheme by Ministry of Social Justice for SC students admitted to premier institutions (IITs, IIMs, NITs, AIIMS, etc.).
benefits: Full tuition fee, living expenses up to Rs. 3,000/month, book grant Rs. 5,000/year, computer/laptop allowance (one-time Rs. 45,000).
applicationSteps: Verify admission in listed premier institution
Fill in scholarship application with caste and income details

name: Gujarat Digital Seva Setu Scholarship
description: Scholarship for students from Gujarat belonging to SC/ST/OBC categories pursuing undergraduate and postgraduate courses.
benefits: Tuition fee and exam fee reimbursement along with maintenance allowance based on course type.
applicationSteps: Fill in caste, income, and academic details

name: Odisha Prerana Scholarship for SC/ST
description: Merit-based scholarship for SC/ST students of Odisha studying in government residential schools for classes 6-10.
benefits: Rs. 75,000 per annum covering boarding, lodging, and coaching for competitive exams in residential schools.
applicationSteps: Selected students enrolled in residential program

name: J&K Special Scholarship Scheme
description: Special scholarship for students from Jammu & Kashmir to pursue undergraduate studies in institutions outside the UT.
benefits: Full tuition fee (up to Rs. 3 lakh), hostel and mess charges, and maintenance allowance for the course duration.
